question: Which answer gives the correct functions of both the cytoplasm AND the cell membrane?

answers.a:
The Cytoplasm is the place where cell reactions take place.
The cell membrane controls what goes in and out of a cell
answers.b:
The Cytoplasm controls cell division
The cell membrane gives support to the cell
answers.c:
The Cytoplasm gives support to the cell
The cell membrane place where cell reactions take place
answers.d:
The Cytoplasm controls cell division
The cell membrane controls what goes in and out of a cell

question: Which of these cellular structures contain DNA?
If the cell has a protien which it wants to leave the cell, what organelles MUST it go though ?
What is the benefit of Endoplasmic Recticulum being positioned how it is relative to the nucleus?

answers.a: Being close to the nucleus helps the Endoplasmic Recticulum keep it's shape
answers.b: Being far from the nucleus means it's easier for molecule to enter both organelle
answers.c: Being close to the nucleus means the the Endoplasmic Recticulum is better at synthesising protiens
answers.d: Being far to the nucleus means the the Endoplasmic Recticulum is better at synthesising lipids

What are ribosomes made up of?

Is the Golgi stack the same as the Golgi cisternae?

answers.a: Lysosomes - involved in synthesizing amino acids
answers.b: Endoplasmic reticulum - plays a role in synthesising protiens and lipids
